Crime_Name: Judicial Review of Pre-Removal Risk Assessment
Evidence_Assessment: Failure to respond to request for additional information
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to demonstrate procedural unfairness
Legal_Rule: Procedural fairness requires notification, but applicants must keep contact information updated
Procedural_Issue: Lack of direct notification to applicants
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Applicants not blameless due to failure to update contact information
Key_Evidence_Considered: Request for further evidence sent to former lawyer
Legal_Rule_Source: Case law on procedural fairness in immigration decisions
Defendant_Response: Applicants failed to update their file after changing representation
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, correspondence with former counsel
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of PRRA refusal and remittal
Legal_Provision: Section 101(1)(f) of IRPA, principles of natural justice
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 101(1)(f), case law on procedural fairness
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to respond to information request
Outcome_of_Review: No error in process found; dismissal upheld
Governing_Rule: Duty of procedural fairness subject to applicant responsibility
